Package main

Class Driver

java.lang.Object
main.Driver
public class Driver extends Object
The Driver class handles sorting different shapes based on user selected criteria. Driver parses command line arguments to determine the file containing shapes data, the criteria for comparison (i.e., volume, height, or base area), and the sorting algorithm to use. The results, including performance metrics and every 1000th value of the sorted list, are then displayed. Created on October 17, 2023
Version:
1.5
Author:
ZoÃ« Goodwin, Mousamiben Desai, Sourabh Thakur

  • Constructor Details

      public Driver()

  • Method Details

    • main

      public static void main(String[] args)
      Entry point of the program. Processes command-line arguments for file name, type of comparison, and sorting algorithm; loads shapes from the file; sorts them; and then prints the sorting results and performance metrics.
      Parameters:
      args - Command-line arguments for specifying input file, comparison type, and sorting algorithm.

    • parseCase

      private static String parseCase(String[] args, char flag)
      Parses the command-line arguments to find a match for a specified flag. This method is case-insensitive for the flag character.
      Parameters:
      args - The array of command-line arguments.
      flag - The flag character to look for, case-insensitive.
      Returns:
      The string argument corresponding to the flag, or null if not found.

    • loadShapesFile

      private static AbstractShape[] loadShapesFile(String fileName)
      Loads shapes from a specified file into an array of AbstractShape. The method uses reflection to instantiate shape objects based on the shape data provided in the file.
      Parameters:
      fileName - The path of the file containing shape data.
      Returns:
      An array of AbstractShape objects, or null if the file cannot be loaded or parsed correctly.

    • sortShapes

      private static void sortShapes(AbstractShape[] shapes, String typeComparison, String sortingAlgorithm)
      Sorts an array of AbstractShape objects based on a specified comparison type and sorting algorithm. The method determines the appropriate Comparator for the shapes and uses the specified algorithm from the Utility class for sorting.
      Parameters:
      shapes - The array of AbstractShape objects to be sorted.
      typeComparison - The criteria for comparison (e.g., volume, height, base area).
      sortingAlgorithm - The sorting algorithm to use (e.g., bubble, selection, insertion).

    • inputGuide

      private static void inputGuide()
      Prints a guide for the expected input format when the command-line inputs are incomplete or incorrect.

    • printResults

      private static void printResults(AbstractShape[] shapes, long algorithmDuration)
      Displays the results of the sorting operation, including the algorithm's duration and a selection of sorted shapes from the list.
      Parameters:
      shapes - An array of sorted AbstractShape objects.
      algorithmDuration - The time taken to sort the shapes, in milliseconds.
